prompt_markdown: What does it mean for an I/O operation to be **blocking**? What happens to a process when it makes a blocking read() call on a socket with no data available?

criteria.name: definition
criteria.description: Correctly defines blocking I/O as waiting until operation completes

criteria.name: process-state
criteria.description: Explains process is put to sleep and removed from CPU

criteria.name: wakeup
criteria.description: Mentions how/when the process is woken up

expected_key_points: blocking means the call doesn't return until data is available
process is moved to a waiting/sleeping state
CPU is free to run other processes
kernel wakes process when data arrives
common_mistakes: thinking blocking means CPU is busy-waiting
not understanding the process state transition
confusing with non-blocking or async I/O
